Items.Title: Land Use Call-Ups

By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Katz:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. C 070312 ZSK, a special permit, shall be subject to Council review.  This application is related to application no. C 070313 HAK that is subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Liberty Avenue, Brooklyn (C070312ZSK)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Gerson:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 101 Rivington Street Community Board 3 Application 20075509 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk Café, 101 Rivington Street, CB#3 (20075509 TCM)

Items.Title:
By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Katz:

C 070314 (A) ZMQ, C 070315 (A) ZMQ, C 070316 HUQ, N 070317 HGQ, C 0700322 HDQ that are subject to Council review pursuant to Sections 197-c and 201 of the New York City Charter.

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to payments to city contractors by electronic funds transfer.

Items.MatterName: Payments to city contractors by electronic funds transfer.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Finance
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to a  rebate of  real property taxes on certain residential real property.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Rebate of real property taxes on certain residential real property.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to extending for one year the time to apply for certain benefits under the industrial and commercial incentive program in a city having a population of one million or more.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Extending for one year the time to apply for certain benefits under the industrial and commercial incentive program in a city having a population of one million or more.

Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Bayside Village business improvement district.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Housing and Buildings
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the regulation of general contractors of new one-, two- or three-family homes.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Regulation and licensing of residential contractors.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to illegal conversions of manufacturing or industrial space to residential use.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Increasing fines for illegal conversions from industrial to residential uses.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to inspection cycles for exterior walls.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Requiring that critical examinations of building facades for buildings greater than six stories in height take place on a five-year cycle starting from the year in which the building was erected.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to solid waste collections.

Items.MatterName: Solid waste collections.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on United States corporate sponsors of the 2008 Beijing Summer Olympics with headquarters and operations in New York City to meaningfully engage the Chinese government in proactively addressing their role in the ongoing crisis in Darfur and to withdraw from and withhold any commitment to support the Olympics if the Chinese government fails to sever its financial connections with Sudan or to leverage its connections to hold Sudan accountable for ending the genocide in Darfur before December 31, 2007.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries, & International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Calling on US corporate sponsors of the 2008 Beijing Summer Olympics with headquarters and operations in NYC to meaningfully engage the Chinese government in proactively addressing their role in the ongoing crisis in Darfur.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Department of City Planning to promulgate rules to ensure that no new residential developments shall be certified unless and until the Department of City Planning certifies the presence or projected presence of sufficient open space for the neighborhood’s current and projected residential and commercial population.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: City Planning to promulgate rules to ensure that no new residential developments shall be certified.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Department of City Planning to promulgate rules to ensure that no new residential developments shall be certified unless and until the Department of City Planning certifies the presence or projected presence of sufficient school space for the neighborhood’s current and projected population of school age children.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: City Planning to promulgate rules to ensure that no new residential developments shall be certified.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Department of City Planning to propose a text amendment to the zoning resolution, creating a new Use Group governing Telecom Hotels, mandating that Telecom Hotels never be located in commercial, residential or special mixed use districts.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Department of City Planning to propose a text amendment to the zoning resolution, creating a new Use Group governing Telecom Hotels.

Items.MatterName: City Planning to regulate the special manufacturing districts of NoHo, SoHo and Tribeca as residential use districts.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring reports to the city council of any variance or special permit granted when the community board recommended disapproval or approval with conditions.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Requiring reports to the city council of any variance or special permit granted when the community board recommended disapproval or approval with conditions.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the New York State Board of Elections to promptly commission the development of a Precinct Based Optical Scan voting system that would comply with New York State voting system standards, which would be owned entirely by the State of New York and would be certified for use by the county Boards of Elections and by the Board of Elections in the City of New York.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: NYS Board of Elections to promptly commission the development of a Precinct Based Optical Scan voting system that would comply with New York State voting system standards.

Items.MatterName: Establishing a New York City Municipal Identification Card.

Items.Title: Resolution denouncing the use by President Bush and Homeland Security Secretary Chertoff of a flawed risk-based allotment of anti-terrorism grants and failing to recognize that New York City is one of the top targets for an international terrorist attack, and calling on President Bush and Homeland Security Secretary Chertoff to increase homeland security funding for New York City.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to introduce and adopt, and the Governor to sign, legislation which would amend the New York State Real Property Tax Law (RPTL) to expand the veterans’ property tax exemption to include an exemption on the school portion of the tax for veterans with incomes below $47,500 and to increase the maximum income eligibility thresholds of the Senior Citizen Homeowners Exemption (SCHE) program and the Disabled Homeowners Exemption (DHE) program to the same level.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Finance
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Amend the NYS Real Property Tax Law (RPTL) to expand the veterans’ property tax exemption to include an exemption on the school portion of the tax for veterans with incomes below $47,500.

At this point, the Speaker (Council Member Quinn) asked for a Moment of Silence for the following individuals:

Police Officers Russel Timoshenko, 23, who died in the line of duty on July 14, 2007.

PFC LeRon Wilson, 18, of Springfield Gardens, Queens (CM Comrie's district), killed in Iraq on July 6. 2007 when an improvised explosive device detonated near his vehicle.

Lance Cpl. Angel Ramirez, 28, of Sunset Park, Brooklyn (CMs DeBlasio and Gonzalez districts) who died on February 21, 2007 of wounds suffered on December 21, 2006 in a non-hostile incident under investigation. 

Spec. Alex Jimenez, 25, born in Queens, abducted on May 12, 2007 in Iraq and listed as "missing/captured".

M.M. Graff, 97,of Brooklyn, a  tireless  civic leader who fought to maintain and save NYC parks.

At this point, the Speaker (Council Member Quinn) acknowledged Victor L. Robles's final Stated Meeting before retirement as City Clerk and Clerk of the Council.  He was first elected City Clerk by the Council in October 2001.  His 30 years of dedicated service to North Brooklyn and the City in various positions including Commissioner of Human Rights, NYS Assembly Member, NYC Council Member was noted and commended.
